title: PAWNSHOP / ROY
description: You talk to Roy, the pawnbroker, about items you'd like to sell, your missing side arm, his drug habit, the People's Pile, and/or the traffic menace.

dialogueTree.text: "If you don't mind, please put the flashlight away. Some of us have photonic sensitivities."

links.text: 'Photonic sensitivity' is not generally acknowledged by the medical establishment.
"Oh right, sorry about that."
"I do appreciate it."
"No, this is my thing." (Keep holding the flashlight.)
"Put the flashlight away, officer. Having it is a privilege, not a right."
"Officer please, I'm serious."
"Textbook narcomaniac behaviour."
"That's the pyrho talking -- there is no flashlight."
[Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Between you and me," he looks you..."
dialogueTree.text: "Between you and me," he looks you up and down, "this is why I don't get involved in local politics."

links.title: You: ""You're calling this *politics*?""
links.text: "You're calling this *politics*?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""In its purest form. Now, what can..."
links.text: "In its purest form. Now, what can I do for you?"

links.title: You: ""Well, someone has to.""
links.text: "Well, someone has to."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""So it goes." The pawnbroker nods g..."
links.text: "So it goes." The pawnbroker nods gravely, then shrugs. "Now, what can I do for you?" he asks.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I shouldn't have either.""
links.text: "Yeah, I shouldn't have either."

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I see you were wounded in the rece..."
dialogueTree.text: "I see you were wounded in the recent... altercation," he says with a grave nod. "A speedy recovery to you, officer."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Now, what can I do for you?""
links.text: "Now, what can I do for you?"

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I see you were wounded in the rece..."
dialogueTree.text: "I see you were wounded in the recent... altercation." He nods gravely at your leg. "A speedy recovery to you, officer."

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hello hello! Let me know if I can..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello hello! Let me know if I can help you with anything."

links.title: You: ""Do you recognise net worth in here..."
links.text: "Do you recognise net worth in here? I have a *lot* of it." (Show him the certificate.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He scans the document in your hand...."
links.text: He scans the document in your hand. "This is--" He's interrupted by a sudden cough. "I certainly wouldn't pass up the opportunity to acquire something that can make princes out of peons."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Owning shares -- that's where the..."
links.text: "Owning shares -- that's where the proper trade is. Far beyond the pittance I deal with in here."

links.title: Suggestion: "He seems down on himself. Offer a b..."
links.text: He seems down on himself. Offer a bit of positivity and you might put him in a more benevolent mood.

links.title: You: ""Onwards and upwards." (Give him a..."
links.text: "Onwards and upwards." (Give him a thumbs up.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Something like that, officer.""
links.text: "Something like that, officer."

links.title: Suggestion: "That didn't work? He must have sunk..."
links.text: That didn't work? He must have sunk pretty low.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The bric-à-brac man looks at you fr..."
links.text: The bric-à-brac man looks at you from behind two layers of polished glass. It is nearly impossible to read any emotion. He sways slightly and itches his cheek.

links.title: Composure: "He hides his struggle well, just li..."
links.text: He hides his struggle well, just like he does the scarred walls of his shop -- concealed behind stacks of dusty merchandise.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The bric-à-brac man looks at you fr..."
links.text: The bric-à-brac man looks at you from behind two layers of polished glass. It is nearly impossible to read any emotion. He sways slightly and itches his cheek.

links.title: Composure: "If there is any struggle in him, he..."
links.text: If there is any struggle in him, he hides it well, just like he does the scarred walls of his shop -- concealed behind stacks of dusty merchandise.

links.title: You: ""What's wrong with your shop? I lik..."
links.text: "What's wrong with your shop? I like it in here."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Nothing's *wrong* with it. The sho..."
links.text: "Nothing's *wrong* with it. The shop suits me fine. It's just..." He changes tack. "We all need a bit of luck in our lives, you know? A lottery win."

links.title: Empathy: "He's hiding something."
links.text: He's hiding something.

links.title: You: ""Is there something you're not tell..."
links.text: "Is there something you're not telling me?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He lets out a long sigh. "I'm in de..."
links.text: He lets out a long sigh. "I'm in debt, officer. I've felt *stuck* for a long time." He looks at the paper in your hand. "Those stocks -- they could be my way out."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "The pain written in the creases of..."
links.text: The pain written in the creases of his face... sheesh! This is a man who's been trying to catch falling knives for *years*.

links.title: You: ""This debt -- is it the drugs?""
links.text: "This debt -- is it the drugs?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes and no. It started when I had..."
links.text: "Yes and no. It started when I had a bit of extra cash on me after acquiring the shop. Could do anything I wanted with it. So what *does* a young man do in that situation?"

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What *doesn't* he do?"
links.text: What *doesn't* he do?

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I sure as hell didn't know. All I..."
links.text: "I sure as hell didn't know. All I could think to do was pump it into the relief effort. I had to do *something* after I left the frontlines... for them, but also for myself."

links.title: Empathy: "He was already scarred..."
links.text: He was already scarred...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Something just shuddered up his spi..."
links.text: Something just shuddered up his spine.

links.title: Endurance: "Mauled by a nightmare. Bite marks i..."
links.text: Mauled by a nightmare. Bite marks in his bones.

links.title: You: ""Did it help?""
links.text: "Did it help?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""For a little while. But I soon sta..."
links.text: "For a little while. But I soon started searching for other ways to cope with the mental trauma. Being cooped up alone most of the day was exacerbating it... just my own head to consort with."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A friend of mine knew of a way to..."
links.text: "A friend of mine knew of a way to deal with that. That's when I started riding the pyro, as they say. It helped -- a lot, actually. But it was another monthly outgoing... still is."

links.title: Empathy: "And now he needs it just to exist....."
links.text: And now he needs it just to exist...

links.title: You: ""Man, you've really been through th..."
links.text: "Man, you've really been through the wringer."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah. But that's enough of my sob..."
links.text: "Yeah. But that's enough of my sob story. Let's get back to business," he says, as if this conversation has changed nothing between you.

links.title: You: ""Sounds like you've had it hard.""
links.text: "Sounds like you've had it hard."

links.title: You: ""Sounds like you'll just get into d..."
links.text: "Sounds like you'll just get into debt again even if you do pay it off..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No chance. I've got a better grip..."
links.text: "No chance. I've got a better grip on my finances these days. This is a mistake from my younger days that just won't go away."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""But that's enough of my sob story...."
links.text: "But that's enough of my sob story. Let's get back to business," he says, as if this conversation has changed nothing between you.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""For a little while. Being cooped u..."
links.text: "For a little while. Being cooped up alone most of the day wasn't healthy for me... just my own head to consort with. But a friend of mine knew of a way to deal with that."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It helped but it was another month..."
links.text: "It helped but it was another monthly outgoing... still is. It would have been fine but I was naive back then. Didn't think I'd ever run out of money..."

links.title: You: ""That doesn't explain how you got i..."
links.text: "That doesn't explain how you got into *debt*..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No... I soon started searching for..."
links.text: "No... I soon started searching for other ways to cope with the mental trauma. Being cooped up alone most of the day was exacerbating it -- just my own head to consort with."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A friend of mine knew of a way to..."
links.text: "A friend of mine knew of a way to deal with that. That's when I started riding the pyro, as they say. That did help -- a lot, actually. But it was another monthly outgoing... still is."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No... Being cooped up alone most o..."
links.text: "No... Being cooped up alone most of the day wasn't healthy for me -- just my own head to consort with. But a friend of mine knew of a way to deal with that."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It helped but it was another month..."
links.text: "It helped but it was another monthly outgoing... still is. It would have been fine but I was naive back then. Didn't think I'd ever run out of money..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I sure as hell didn't know. So I p..."
links.text: "I sure as hell didn't know. So I pumped it into charities to help the less fortunate. I had to do something... for them, but also for myself."

links.title: You: ""That must have taken its toll on y..."
links.text: "That must have taken its toll on you."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah. It's surprising how haggard..."
links.text: "Yeah. It's surprising how haggard years and years of stress can make you. But that's why it's one of the biggest killers in the world, I guess."

links.title: You: ""How did you get into debt?""
links.text: "How did you get into debt?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""After I acquired the shop I had a..."
links.text: "After I acquired the shop I had a bit of extra cash on my hands. Could do anything I wanted with it. So what *does* a young man do in that situation?"

links.title: You: "Let him hide."
links.text: Let him hide.

links.title: You: ""You want shares off me? I was hopi..."
links.text: "You want shares off me? I was hoping to get a discount or some freebies."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No can do. I need to make money --..."
links.text: "No can do. I need to make money -- this is a business first and foremost. Not a charity."

links.title: You: ""What if I endorse your store? Put..."
links.text: "What if I endorse your store? Put my official stamp of approval on it?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No offence but I don't think it wo..."
links.text: "No offence but I don't think it would do me much good. Nothing to do with you -- it's just my customers tend to be, well... they wouldn't know who you are."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "He's right. His customers are despe..."
links.text: He's right. His customers are desperates, lowlifes, and bored browsers. They don't understand *high culture*. They don't want their purchases to elevate them. They just want some old junk at a bargain price.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I'd be glad to trade for your shar..."
links.text: "I'd be glad to trade for your shares. Let's stick to that."

links.title: You: ""I understand. It was worth a shot.""
links.text: "I understand. It was worth a shot."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Of course. I'd be glad to trade fo..."
links.text: "Of course. I'd be glad to trade for your shares. Let's stick to that."

links.title: You: ""What can I trade for these shares..."
links.text: "What can I trade for these shares then? *Everything*?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""In theory, yes, you probably have..."
links.text: "In theory, yes, you probably have enough to afford it all. However, I don't plan on selling up and joining the mastodons of La Delta just yet."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Shades here is certainly junked up..."
links.text: Shades here is certainly junked up enough to fit in with the big dicks swinging wild and free across the river.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""What I can do is trade that modifi..."
links.text: "What I can do is trade that modified street light over there for some of your shares. It's the most expensive item in here -- the finest in interior lighting."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Expensive isn't everything. Bet thi..."
links.text: Expensive isn't everything. Bet this light doesn't even have a recognisable *brand*. And you can't exactly strut down the street and turn heads with it like you can a new Perseus Black number.

links.title: You: "It's still a physical asset, though..."
links.text: It's still a physical asset, though. Doesn't that count for anything?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Sure it does. Not saying you should..."
links.text: Sure it does. Not saying you should definitely *not* get it. But let's think about what to do with it first. Any ideas?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Turn it into an art installation. I..."
links.text: Turn it into an art installation. Invite viewers to question what it means to bring an outside light, *inside*? We have so many barriers to break down and concepts to explore... for a price, of course.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Imagine swinging it at a ball -- th..."
links.text: Imagine swinging it at a ball -- the distance you'd get! That's the kind of feat that nets sportsmen a corporate sponsorship.

links.title: Interfacing: "There's much to be learned in this..."
links.text: There's much to be learned in this kind of rewiring job. You could steal its secrets and make a whole line of modified street tech to sell to the public.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's been through a whole *transfor..."
links.text: It's been through a whole *transformation*. There are so many insights to share -- it just needs a medium. Wouldn't the wake-walkers pay to hear the somniloquy of the spirit light?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It's up to you. If you think it's g..."
links.text: It's up to you. If you think it's got ROI potential then go ahead. Just bear in mind that these shares are developing into a fortune without you having to do anything.

links.title: You: ""You're selling it for 700 reál, ri..."
links.text: "You're selling it for 700 reál, right?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Right." He nods."
links.text: "Right." He nods.

links.title: You: ""And you won't give me anything els..."
links.text: "And you won't give me anything else for these shares?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Nothing else in here carries that..."
links.text: "Nothing else in here carries that much value, I'm afraid. Plus, I need to make sure I still earn *some* actual cash -- for food and such."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, okay, that seems like it has..."
links.text: "Yeah, okay, that seems like it has potential."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Take a closer look. You'll see the..."
links.text: "Take a closer look. You'll see the quality of the craftsmanship then. Any other questions in the meantime?"

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure. I'll certainly think..."
links.text: "I'm not sure. I'll certainly think about it."

links.title: You: "Good point. I won't bother with it..."
links.text: Good point. I won't bother with it then.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Let's not *completely* write it off..."
links.text: Let's not *completely* write it off yet. Perhaps there's a business venture to be had here. Any ideas?

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for a radio transceive..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a radio transceiver. You got anything?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A transceiver, is it? Yeah, we sho..."
links.text: "A transceiver, is it? Yeah, we should have something to do the trick..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He produces a machine encased in a..."
links.text: He produces a machine encased in a blue bakelite shell, its black face covered in an assortment of pearl-topped knobs and dials.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant whistles a long, qui..."
links.text: The lieutenant whistles a long, quivering note...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A genuine Kristallsprach. This is..."
links.text: "A genuine Kristallsprach. This is a connoisseur's model. Good for picking up foreign milieus."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A Kristallsprach Model 9. Gottwald..."
links.text: "A Kristallsprach Model 9. Gottwaldian engineering at its finest. This is a specialist's model, ideal for picking up foreign signals..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The Model 9 also comes equipped wi..."
links.text: "The Model 9 also comes equipped with a signal purifier to suppress crosstalk, especially good around here with our funky reception."

links.title: Interfacing: "In other words, it'll put even the..."
links.text: In other words, it'll put even the lieutenant's beloved DynaWave to shame.

links.title: You: ""Sounds perfect!""
links.text: "Sounds perfect!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's about as close to perfection..."
links.text: "It's about as close to perfection as a transceiver gets. And we're only asking 120 reál for it."

links.title: You: ""Sounds a bit like overkill.""
links.text: "Sounds a bit like overkill."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Could be, if you're not concerned..."
links.text: "Could be, if you're not concerned about quality of signal. But real audiophiles will pay good money for this. That's why we can't let it go for less than 120 reál."

links.title: You: ""Sounds expensive.""
links.text: "Sounds expensive."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Well it's not that Iilmaraan surpl..."
links.text: "Well it's not that Iilmaraan surplus junk, that's for sure. We think 120 reál is more than reasonable."

links.title: You: ""I'm back for the transceiver. Is i..."
links.text: "I'm back for the transceiver. Is it still available?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""For the moment, yes.""
links.text: "For the moment, yes."

links.title: You: "Buy the highly expensive transceive..."
links.text: Buy the highly expensive transceiver.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You won't regret it, officer. What..."
links.text: "You won't regret it, officer. Whatever you need, the Model 9 can handle."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant watches you take the..."
links.text: The lieutenant watches you take the transceiver with barely disguised envy.

links.title: You: ""You jealous, Kim?""
links.text: "You jealous, Kim?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not at all, detective. A Kristalls..."
links.text: "Not at all, detective. A Kristallsprach is a fine piece of equipment, but I'm quite satisfied with my DynaWave."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Oh, he's *totally* jealous. He can..."
links.text: Oh, he's *totally* jealous. He can barely hold it in!

links.title: You: ""Can't wait to take this baby for a..."
links.text: "Can't wait to take this baby for a spin."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course, you need a certain leve..."
links.text: "Of course, you need a certain level of *discernment* to really appreciate the difference in quality."

links.title: Interfacing: "He's reaching for naked snobbery be..."
links.text: He's reaching for naked snobbery because he knows you've got him *beat* from a technical angle.

links.title: You: ""Do you think we'll actually be abl..."
links.text: "Do you think we'll actually be able to reach the Coalition with this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You've surprised me more than once..."
links.text: "You've surprised me more than once during the course of our investigation, but I have to say it still seems like a *remote* scenario." He shrugs.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To be perfectly frank, I have my r..."
links.text: "To be perfectly frank, I have my reservations about this whole antenna scheme. But who knows? We may yet be surprised."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't like to guess. Your per..."
links.text: "I wouldn't like to guess. Your performance so far doesn't exactly inspire confidence, but all sorts of things are possible..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*You* could reach the Coalition an..."
links.text: "*You* could reach the Coalition and have your talk about *la responsabilité*... *I* could grow 10 centimetres and become a flanker for the Stormers."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The pawnbroker turns from you to th..."
links.text: The pawnbroker turns from you to the lieutenant and back again, a distant look on his face.

links.title: You: ""Thanks, Roy, this is just what I n..."
links.text: "Thanks, Roy, this is just what I needed." (Conclude.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""We're glad to hear it." He smiles..."
links.text: "We're glad to hear it." He smiles as the reflected light dances across his lenses.

links.title: You: ""I'm gonna shop around a bit. I mig..."
links.text: "I'm gonna shop around a bit. I might be back later."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Suit yourself. Can't promise this..."
links.text: "Suit yourself. Can't promise this beauty'll be here when you come back, though." He gently returns the transceiver to its shelf behind the counter.

links.title: You: ""Hey, do you know how to fix this?"..."
links.text: "Hey, do you know how to fix this?" (Show him the bundle of magnetic tape.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He looks at the bronze-coloured bun..."
links.text: He looks at the bronze-coloured bundle in your hand. "You mean re-spool it? Yeah, I do, but..."

links.title: You: ""Great! Could you do it, please? Th..."
links.text: "Great! Could you do it, please? This is important, I need to be able to play this tape for someone."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He slowly finishes his thought: "....."
links.text: He slowly finishes his thought: "...but I'm not some Mr. Fixit, I'm a pawnbroker. If you want to pawn the tape, sure. Although it looks pretty... worthless."

links.title: Suggestion: "Just explain why you need this so m..."
links.text: Just explain why you need this so much. He's bound to understand.

links.title: You: ""Wait, but you tinker with film tap..."
links.text: "Wait, but you tinker with film tapes all the time. Isn't that the same?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No, it's different... those film t..."
links.text: "No, it's different... those film tapes actually *mean* something to me, but this is just a worthless bundle of old tape."

links.title: You: ""Worthless? It's not worthless, Roy..."
links.text: "Worthless? It's not worthless, Roy. This could be the next big thing for the local dance music scene."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Huh?" He slowly taps his fingers o..."
links.text: "Huh?" He slowly taps his fingers on the counter. "What do you mean?"

links.title: You: ""Do you know that old church down t..."
links.text: "Do you know that old church down the coast?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes. What about it?""
links.text: "Yes. What about it?"

links.title: You: ""I helped some young ravers turn th..."
links.text: "I helped some young ravers turn this place into a nightclub. And they play these weird neo-disco beats there..."

links.title: You: ""I met some young ravers near the p..."
links.text: "I met some young ravers near the place. They want to turn the church into a nightclub and play some weird neo-disco beats there. I promised to help them with that."

links.title: You: ""I met some young enthusiasts down..."
links.text: "I met some young enthusiasts down the coast. And they play this weird neo-disco music..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Is it any good? The music, I mean.""
links.text: "Is it any good? The music, I mean."

links.title: You: ""I helped them up the bass beat. It..."
links.text: "I helped them up the bass beat. It's getting pretty *hard core*, but there's something missing. A melody line to complement the beat. I'm feeling this tape might be it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Man, you're really invested in thi..."
links.text: "Man, you're really invested in this." He looks at the bundle of tape in front of him. It shimmers under the shop's dazzling light show.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Okay, I'll help you out. It's goin..."
links.text: "Okay, I'll help you out. It's going to take a moment though, so just sit back and relax..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "You take some time to look around t..."
links.text: You take some time to look around the store... The play of visuals all around the pawnshop is mesmerizing. Suddenly, Roy turns back to you with a reel of tape in his hand and coughs.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You know, these visuals would look..."
links.text: You know, these visuals would look *super cool* in the church.

links.title: You: ""Hey, those visuals you've got here..."
links.text: "Hey, those visuals you've got here would look great in the church." (Point at the lights in the pawnshop.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah, I bet they would... all thos..."
links.text: "Yeah, I bet they would... all those lights in a massive church hall..." He stares at the intricate interplay of light and shadow all around him, suddenly moved by the idea.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A sanctuary filled with hand-picke..."
links.text: "A sanctuary filled with hand-picked positive photons... There would be no room for sadness in such a place. It's a brilliant vision..."

links.title: Empathy: "There's a 'but', isn't there? There..."
links.text: There's a 'but', isn't there? There's always a 'but'.

links.title: You: ""But?""
links.text: "But?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I rather like it *here* too, so ye..."
links.text: "I rather like it *here* too, so yeah -- I'm not giving you my projector. This tape is all I can do for you and your friends' nightclub project." He nods at the fixed tape on the counter top.

links.title: Empathy: "Looks like he really means it."
links.text: Looks like he really means it.

links.title: Rhetoric: "There's no way to turn this around,..."
links.text: There's no way to turn this around, I'm afraid.

links.title: Half Light: "Poor apes on a stupid ball, with ne..."
links.text: Poor apes on a stupid ball, with never enough money to do anything remarkable.

links.title: You: ""You and me, we could make this all..."
links.text: "You and me, we could make this all become true. Mankind *needs* this."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah, man, no." He shakes his head..."
links.text: "Yeah, man, no." He shakes his head. "I rather like this place happy too. You know -- where I work. This tape is all I can do for you and your friends' nightclub project." He nods at the fixed tape on the counter top.

links.title: You: "(Look at the clock.) "Wait, this to..."
links.text: (Look at the clock.) "Wait, this took more than just 'a few moments'. That was at least fifteen minutes!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah." He nods. "It was. Re-spooli..."
links.text: "Yeah." He nods. "It was. Re-spooling isn't that difficult, although I had to mend the tape in a few places."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Anyhow, it's yours now..." He slid..."
links.text: "Anyhow, it's yours now..." He slides the tape closer to you on the counter top.

links.title: You: ""Well, thanks for the help." (Proce..."
links.text: "Well, thanks for the help." (Proceed; take the repaired tape.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah. My pleasure. I do what I can..."
links.text: "Yeah. My pleasure. I do what I can for true passion projects... Just try not to use this tape for negative photon emissions. Take responsibility, okay."

links.title: You: ""No, that's the thing -- you can't..."
links.text: "No, that's the thing -- you can't believe how unbelievably thin the beat is. There's nothing to it, no bass! It just goes *bzoot-bzoot-bzoot*. But this tape could make it *hard core*.

links.title: You: ""Not very. I need to funk it up.""
links.text: "Not very. I need to funk it up."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You're quite invested in this." He..."
links.text: "You're quite invested in this." He looks at the bundle of tape in front of him. It shimmers under the shop's dazzling light show.

links.title: You: ""Hmh, maybe you can help me some ot..."
links.text: "Hmh, maybe you can help me some other way, then."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sure..." he mumbles as his eyes on..."
links.text: "Sure..." he mumbles as his eyes once again start following the light show around the pawnshop.

links.title: You: ""Care to share your Pyrholidon with..."
links.text: "Care to share your Pyrholidon with me?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Here you go, man." He presents a l..."
links.text: "Here you go, man." He presents a large cap-shaped object on the palm of his hand. Very odd-looking...

links.title: Volition: "Not so sure about this."
links.text: Not so sure about this.

links.title: You: "Wait, why wouldn't I be sure?"
links.text: Wait, why wouldn't I be sure?

links.title: Volition: "Because it's an anti-radiation drug..."
links.text: Because it's an anti-radiation drug and you're a cop, not a post-apocalyptic scavenger?

links.title: You: ""Thanks, man." (Take the pyrholidon..."
links.text: "Thanks, man." (Take the pyrholidon.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He looks down. "Of course.""
links.text: He looks down. "Of course."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I changed my mind. I don..."
links.text: "Actually, I changed my mind. I don't need any Pyrholidon." (Refuse to take the pyrholidon for now.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I respect your decision, officer...."
links.text: "I respect your decision, officer. What else can I help you with?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Have you tried it before?""
links.text: "Have you tried it before?"

links.title: Suggestion: "It's almost like he's worried for y..."
links.text: It's almost like he's worried for you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant steps away, pretendi..."
links.text: The lieutenant steps away, pretending to admire some of the knick-knacks on display. Looks like he doesn't want to get involved...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "...go ahead then, he thinks. As lon..."
links.text: ...go ahead then, he thinks. As long as you can walk straight, I don't care.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He won't be your narc -- but he won..."
links.text: He won't be your narc -- but he won't be thrilled about this either.

links.title: You: ""I think I've tried it once -- and..."
links.text: "I think I've tried it once -- and liked it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Here you go, man." He presents a l..."
links.text: "Here you go, man." He presents a large cap-shaped object on the palm of his hand. Very odd-looking...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Yes, darling, that's the Coalition..."
links.text: Yes, darling, that's the Coalition Government ordained Pyrholidon -- straight into your gut!

links.title: You: ""I haven't -- but don't worry, I ca..."
links.text: "I haven't -- but don't worry, I can take it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""If you say so...""
links.text: "If you say so..."

links.title: You: ""I ride the *pyrho* every day.""
links.text: "I ride the *pyrho* every day."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Every day?" He tilts his head, stu..."
links.text: "Every day?" He tilts his head, studying you, then nods. "You look the part."

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for something that pla..."
links.text: "I'm looking for something that plays a tape. For police business."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A tape? We have boomboxes for sale..."
links.text: "A tape? We have boomboxes for sale that will play it. Check the shelves."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah, we still have those boomboxe..."
links.text: "Yeah, we still have those boomboxes on the shelves."

links.title: You: ""The boombox I bought... it should..."
links.text: "The boombox I bought... it should play this tape, right?

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Of course. It's in working order s..."
links.text: "Of course. It's in working order still, isn't it? Just pick your tape and set it spinning. It all starts with the tape."

links.title: You: ""There's something I'd like to sell.""
links.text: "There's something I'd like to sell."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, we'd like to sell these hubca..."
links.text: "Yes, we'd like to sell these hubcaps," the lieutenant steps in and hands him the spinners.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "Roy takes the hubcaps from the lieu..."
links.text: Roy takes the hubcaps from the lieutenant and inspects them. The spinners appear iridescent in the dancing light of his pawnshop.

links.title: Interfacing: "Gone forever..."
links.text: Gone forever...

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He marvels at the cobalt shimmer, a..."
links.text: He marvels at the cobalt shimmer, and nods: "Yes, these are very, very good. Did you defraud some foreign prince for them? Jump a Mesque banger? No matter... I'll give you 200 reál."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No one was defrauded or *jumped*,..."
links.text: "No one was defrauded or *jumped*, I assure you," the lieutenant explains as the pawnbroker opens the register and counts the cash.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Of course. I meant no offense. 200..."
links.text: "Of course. I meant no offense. 200 reál for you, officer. Delightful doing business with you. Do come again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you." He takes the cash, the..."
links.text: "Thank you." He takes the cash, then turns to you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here's the 30 reál you need for yo..."
links.text: "Here's the 30 reál you need for your bill. Do *not* waste it." The rest goes in his pocket.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The rest is for him -- to compensat..."
links.text: The rest is for him -- to compensate for the pain of being separated from his radiant spinners.

links.title: Empathy: "The windfall is a small consolation..."
links.text: The windfall is a small consolation.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Anything else you're thinking of s..."
links.text: "Anything else you're thinking of selling?" Both the lieutenant and the pawnbroker turn to you.

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "You can sell things from your ITEMS..."
links.text: You can sell things from your ITEMS tab for cash -- but be careful: You might wish you had them later.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here's the 60 reál you need for yo..."
links.text: "Here's the 60 reál you need for your bill. Do *not* waste it." The rest goes in his pocket.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here's the 70 reál you need for yo..."
links.text: "Here's the 70 reál you need for your bill. Do *not* waste it." The rest goes in his pocket.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here's the 100 reál you need for y..."
links.text: "Here's the 100 reál you need for your bill. Do *not* waste it." The rest goes in his pocket.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here's the 130 reál you need for y..."
links.text: "Here's the 130 reál you need for your bill. Do *not* waste it." The rest goes in his pocket.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Let me have a look.""
links.text: "Let me have a look."

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "You can sell things from your ITEMS..."
links.text: You can sell things from your ITEMS tab for cash -- but be careful: You might wish you had them later.

links.title: You: ""I'd like to sell my clothes.""
links.text: "I'd like to sell my clothes."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I'm not purchasing any more clothi..."
links.text: "I'm not purchasing any more clothing at the moment..." He looks you up and down quickly.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "Suddenly, his gaze fixes on your ti..."
links.text: Suddenly, his gaze fixes on your tie. He steps back from the glass. "And *especially* that tie. It swallows photons around it. I have no need for *necrotic* objects."

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Your *mother* is a necrotic object...."
links.text: Your *mother* is a necrotic object. I'm fun. Look at me sparkle in the light of the projector!

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I'm not purchasing any more clothi..."
links.text: "I'm not purchasing any more clothing at the moment." He looks you up and down quickly. "And certainly not expensive armour that's liable to bring mercenaries to my doorstep."

links.title: You: ""I have some armour...""
links.text: "I have some armour..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""More than sure. What else have you..."
links.text: "More than sure. What else have you got?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He knits his eyebrows, thinking, th..."
links.text: He knits his eyebrows, thinking, then says, "Alright, let's see it."

links.title: You: ""I've got these sabatons." (Show hi..."
links.text: "I've got these sabatons." (Show him.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He steps back, away from the glass...."
links.text: He steps back, away from the glass. "Oh, no, no, no, no. I don't need blood-thirsty mercenaries knocking on my door looking for their missing toys."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Besides, this gear costs a fortune..."
links.text: "Besides, this gear costs a fortune -- there's no one in Martinaise with that kind of money."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It feels like he would have accepte..."
links.text: It feels like he would have accepted the risk if he hoped to profit from it. It's not greed, though. Deep down, he's a gambler -- provided the stakes are sufficiently interesting.

links.title: You: ""Just look at this awesome cuirass...."
links.text: "Just look at this awesome cuirass." (Show him.)

links.title: You: ""I've got a helmet." (Show him.)"
links.text: "I've got a helmet." (Show him.)

links.title: You: ""Well, there are these gauntlets......"
links.text: "Well, there are these gauntlets..." (Show him.)

links.title: You: ""I have a fascinating photo of a co..."
links.text: "I have a fascinating photo of a corpse here." (Show him the photo.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh... no, I don't like those kinds..."
links.text: "Oh... no, I don't like those kinds of objects. No sale." He barely even looks at it.

links.title: You: ""Do you know what the tattoos mean?""
links.text: "Do you know what the tattoos mean?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He frowns. "Aphotic paths? Counter-..."
links.text: He frowns. "Aphotic paths? Counter-radiance networks? Antimagnetism? It's darkness. That's all I know. Sell me something *lighter*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "You have absolutely no idea what *a..."
links.text: You have absolutely no idea what *aphotic paths* are, but the tattoos on the man are not that.

links.title: You: ""I have this commemorative pin, but..."
links.text: "I have this commemorative pin, but before I sell it I have some questions." (Show him Lena's pin.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He studies the pin carefully, rolli..."
links.text: He studies the pin carefully, rolling it around in his palm. "Saint-Batiste Summer Dinghy Races '31. What a pleasant time *that* was."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""So, what do you want to know? Pric..."
links.text: "So, what do you want to know? Price? I can give you 3.20 for it."

links.title: You: ""3.20? Hey, that's a rip-off!""
links.text: "3.20? Hey, that's a rip-off!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A pin from '31 ought to be priced..."
links.text: "A pin from '31 ought to be priced at 3.10 -- but I added another ten cents, just to be nice."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but can you hold onto it for..."
links.text: "Okay, but can you hold onto it for a few days before putting it up for sale? I promised to give the pin back..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He thinks for a moment, then nods...."
links.text: He thinks for a moment, then nods. "Sure, I can keep it behind the counter for a week -- but only if you pawn it right now."

links.title: You: ""That's all I wanted to know about..."
links.text: "That's all I wanted to know about the pin, thanks."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sure thing. So, do you want to sel..."
links.text: "Sure thing. So, do you want to sell anything?"

links.title: You: ""I'll check my pockets." (Access yo..."
links.text: "I'll check my pockets." (Access your pawn menu.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Anything else you're thinking of s..."
links.text: "Anything else you're thinking of selling?"

links.title: You: ""I don't have anything to sell at t..."
links.text: "I don't have anything to sell at the moment."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Another time, perhaps.""
links.text: "Another time, perhaps."

links.title: You: ""I'd like to buy back the commemora..."
links.text: "I'd like to buy back the commemorative pin I sold."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes! Fortunately, I still have it...."
links.text: "Yes! Fortunately, I still have it. 3.30 and it's yours."

links.title: You: ""3.30? But I sold it for 3.20...""
links.text: "3.30? But I sold it for 3.20..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes, you did, but this is how pawn..."
links.text: "Yes, you did, but this is how pawnshops make profit..." He tilts his head, waiting. "So, do you want it or not?"

links.title: You: "Buy the pin."
links.text: Buy the pin.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Here you go, officer." He hands yo..."
links.text: "Here you go, officer." He hands you the pin. "Anything else I can do for you today?"

links.title: You: ""Actually, no -- I don't have the m..."
links.text: "Actually, no -- I don't have the money."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Your choice, officer. I can't prom..."
links.text: "Your choice, officer. I can't promise I can hold on to it for much longer, however."

links.title: You: "Is Roy high -- and if yes, then wha..."
links.text: Is Roy high -- and if yes, then what is he on?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Feeling warm and enthralled by the..."
links.text: Feeling warm and enthralled by the movement of light, while the mind continues to race forward? Lucky bastard -- he's probably on Pyrholidon. It's tough to come by on the street.

links.title: You: "Pyrholidon? What is that?"
links.text: Pyrholidon? What is that?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "A drug developed by the military to..."
links.text: A drug developed by the military to treat and prevent radiation sickness. It has psychedelic side-effects. *And* it makes your eyes turn yellow!

links.title: You: ""Is it just me, or is it really war..."
links.text: "Is it just me, or is it really warm in here?" (Look around.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He tilts his head. "I try to keep t..."
links.text: He tilts his head. "I try to keep the shop at a comfortable temperature."

links.title: Empathy: "There's a note of indignation in hi..."
links.text: There's a note of indignation in his voice. Interesting.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Those triangle patches on his vest...."
links.text: Those triangle patches on his vest... you have a feeling they *mean* something. Like they're similar to the halogen rectangle on your jacket.

links.title: You: "(Point at his clothes.) "Say, what'..."
links.text: (Point at his clothes.) "Say, what's with the triangles on your vest?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He hesitates. "I was... I was with..."
links.text: He hesitates. "I was... I was with the Emergency Relief Brigade. You know, after the People's Pile disaster." He coughs, as if to mark his words.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Had to take Pyrholidon for radiati..."
links.text: "Had to take Pyrholidon for radiation sickness. That's what you were hinting at just now, wasn't it?"

links.title: You: ""It's pretty obvious that you're un..."
links.text: "It's pretty obvious that you're under the influence, sir."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He frowns. "Pyrholidon is just some..."
links.text: He frowns. "Pyrholidon is just something I... you know, since the People's Pile disaster." He coughs, as if to mark his words.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I was with the Emergency Relief Br..."
links.text: "I was with the Emergency Relief Brigade. Had to take it for radiation sickness."

links.title: You: ""No judgement -- just curious. I pr..."
links.text: "No judgement -- just curious. I probably did loads of Pyrholidon before I lost my memory."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I've *had* to take it, you know, s..."
links.text: "I've *had* to take it, you know, since the People's Pile clean-up," he responds carefully. "I was with the Emergency Relief Brigade."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "He's taking it for mental and emoti..."
links.text: He's taking it for mental and emotional, not physical pain these days.

links.title: You: ""The People's Pile? What's that?""
links.text: "The People's Pile? What's that?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A bad idea. Some poor leftists bui..."
links.text: "A bad idea. Some poor leftists built a particle decay generator in hopes of bringing affordable electricity to under-served communities. It malfunctioned. Radioactive waste everywhere, probably some of it in *you*, too."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The People's Pile was a Type U part..."
links.text: The People's Pile was a Type U particle decay generator that failed immediately after entering service, releasing radioactive waste into River Esperance.

links.title: You: "What is a particle decay generator?"
links.text: What is a particle decay generator?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "A primitive nuclear reactor, also c..."
links.text: A primitive nuclear reactor, also called a *pile*.

links.title: You: "Why is it called the *People's* Pil..."
links.text: Why is it called the *People's* Pile?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Construction began during the Commu..."
links.text: Construction began during the Commune of Revachol. The *people* continued work on it after the Commune fell -- they wanted a cheap source of energy for Revachol West.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Needless to say: things didn't work..."
links.text: Needless to say: things didn't work out.

links.title: You: "Why did it fail? (Conclude.)"
links.text: Why did it fail? (Conclude.)

links.title: Encyclopedia: "An emergency valve defect resulted..."
links.text: An emergency valve defect resulted in steam pressure blowing the turbine, taking the fuel containment vessel up in the explosion. Both the faulty design and lack of finances contributed to the catastrophe.

links.title: You: ""Tell me more about this Emergency..."
links.text: "Tell me more about this Emergency Relief Brigade you were part of."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He points at the white triangle on..."
links.text: He points at the white triangle on his orange safety jacket. "We were an all-volunteer force, self-organized. Tried to help fire brigades contain the spill."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "On the patch -- gamma radiation lin..."
links.text: On the patch -- gamma radiation lines crossed with a red drop of blood.

links.title: Endurance: "Tough son of a gun, this one. Respe..."
links.text: Tough son of a gun, this one. Respect.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I lived by the river since I was a..."
links.text: "I lived by the river since I was a small boy. The Esperance... didn't have the heart to let it all go to shit without trying to *do* something, to help out."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""There wasn't much the volunteer fo..."
links.text: "There wasn't much the volunteer force could do, however. We wasted years in the river mud. Years getting sick..." He looks at the spiralling light and stops.

links.title: You: ""It must have been tough -- radioac..."
links.text: "It must have been tough -- radioactive clean-up."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He hesitates. "There's a reason why..."
links.text: He hesitates. "There's a reason why everyone's tried to forget any of it ever happened, and why no one has tried to repair or replace the Pile."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""So much disappointment -- and earl..."
links.text: "So much disappointment -- and early deaths, cancer mostly. And we knew all that was coming even as we were *cleaning up* as best we could."

links.title: You: ""Whose fault was it that the genera..."
links.text: "Whose fault was it that the generator failed?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No one's, everyone's..." He sighs..."
links.text: "No one's, everyone's..." He sighs and shakes his head.

links.title: Empathy: "So much bitterness."
links.text: So much bitterness.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A bunch of poor people built thems..."
links.text: "A bunch of poor people built themselves a primitive nuclear reactor, hoping for the best. What do you think is going to happen?"

links.title: You: ""How did you end up running a pawns..."
links.text: "How did you end up running a pawnshop?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The clean-up happened fifteen year..."
links.text: "The clean-up happened fifteen years ago. I was young then. Later my second aunt died, left me this shack and the assorted junk in it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""So I came to Martinaise. People to..."
links.text: "So I came to Martinaise. People told me don't go there, it's a *shit-hole*. I said: people, we just had a *nuclear pile meltdown*. I'm gonna get as far from Faubourg as I can. Still in the same city, but..." He shrugs.

links.title: You: ""Thank you for telling me." (Conclu..."
links.text: "Thank you for telling me." (Conclude.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He shrugs. "I like theory more than..."
links.text: He shrugs. "I like theory more than story. Outward movement, not vortices."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Yeah... you gotta get in on those v..."
links.text: Yeah... you gotta get in on those vortices, my man.

links.title: You: ""Chill out, man -- I'm a chill out..."
links.text: "Chill out, man -- I'm a chill out cop who just wants some of what you're having." (Wink.)

links.title: You: ""I didn't mean to offend you." (Dro..."
links.text: "I didn't mean to offend you." (Drop the subject -- you don't want drugs.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "His loosens up. "I'm not offended,..."
links.text: His loosens up. "I'm not offended, officer."

links.title: You: "(Step closer.) "Sir, could you take..."
links.text: (Step closer.) "Sir, could you take off your sunglasses? I'd like to check your eyes."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Why on earth?" He staggers away fr..."
links.text: "Why on earth?" He staggers away from the glass, but quickly recomposes himself. "These are prescription. I can't really see without them."

links.title: You: "(Get straight to the point.) "So, w..."
links.text: (Get straight to the point.) "So, where does a man get Pyrholidon these days?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He takes a step back, studying you...."
links.text: He takes a step back, studying you. "How would I know?"

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Nope, still no clue. You obviously..."
links.text: Nope, still no clue. You obviously haven't been doing enough drugs lately.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Okay, he definitely *is* high. What..."
links.text: Okay, he definitely *is* high. Whatever it is you've probably done it -- and many other things besides. But you can't cut through the jumble of sensations to get to the answer.

links.title: Logic: "Looking at his wares, talking to hi..."
links.text: Looking at his wares, talking to him -- that might give you more clues.

links.title: Empathy: "A guarded man like him wouldn't tel..."
links.text: A guarded man like him wouldn't tell you if you asked out loud.

links.title: You: ""Do you know anything about the tra..."
links.text: "Do you know anything about the traffic menace on the loose?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Traffic... I'm sorry, officer, but..."
links.text: "Traffic... I'm sorry, officer, but I don't drive."

links.title: You: ""Wait, why don't you drive?""
links.text: "Wait, why don't you drive?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I just don't like it very much. Mo..."
links.text: "I just don't like it very much. Movement on the road never really gelled well with the movement of my thoughts."

links.title: You: ""But didn't you hear it when the tr..."
links.text: "But didn't you hear it when the traffic menace drove over your roof?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Now that I think about it, I do re..."
links.text: "Now that I think about it, I do remember hearing a thunderous noise the other night -- some kind of powerful electric vortex hitting the shop and then moving on..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That sure narrows down our list of..."
links.text: "That sure narrows down our list of suspects."

links.title: You: ""A vortex? Sounds fascinating.""
links.text: "A vortex? Sounds fascinating."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yeah, it was pretty wild. I didn't..."
links.text: "Yeah, it was pretty wild. I didn't really know what to make of it, but I know it meant *something*."

links.title: You: ""Does that mean you don't have any..."
links.text: "Does that mean you don't have any idea who the driver was?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He shakes his head slowly."
links.text: He shakes his head slowly.

links.title: You: ""I can understand how you would mis..."
links.text: "I can understand how you would mistake Jacob Irw for a powerful electric vortex."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Jacob Irw? The great TipTop champi..."
links.text: "Jacob Irw? The great TipTop champion? Yes, yes..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "His forehead creases. "Do you think..."
links.text: His forehead creases. "Do you think it may have been... Jacob Irw who drove over your roof?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's a logical explanation. I felt..."
links.text: "It's a logical explanation. I felt within that thunderous crash a soul plunged into chaos."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I felt within that thunderous cras..."
links.text: "I felt within that thunderous crash a soul plunged into chaos."

links.title: You: ""Yet another sign that the end is n..."
links.text: "Yet another sign that the end is nigh... It must be destiny that brought me here. Tell me more about this vortex?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The end... I don't know about that..."
links.text: "The end... I don't know about that. Seemed more like a sign of a large-scale transformation. Shook the entire shack."

links.title: You: ""The vortex is going to become much..."
links.text: "The vortex is going to become much bigger -- it is an integral part of how it all ends."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""An *end* implies a stable state, w..."
links.text: "An *end* implies a stable state, whereas we can see from experience that everything is in fact always transforming. Thus, there can be no end."

links.title: You: ""But that is merely our meagre sens..."
links.text: "But that is merely our meagre sense experience. There are dark forces at work now that we cannot even envision, much less see."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The dark always has its counterbal..."
links.text: "The dark always has its counterbalance in light. Neither will prevail. The cycle will continue." He folds his arms with finality and turns away from you, concentrating once more on his light show.

links.title: You: ""You might be able to aid my invest..."
links.text: "You might be able to aid my investigation."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I doubt it, but I can try to answe..."
links.text: "I doubt it, but I can try to answer any questions you may have."

links.title: You: ""Know anything about the recent han..."
links.text: "Know anything about the recent hanging?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I do my best to keep my distance f..."
links.text: "I do my best to keep my distance from all manner of butchery. Bad for business, bad for everyone."

links.title: Drama: "He doesn't know anything."
links.text: He doesn't know anything.

links.title: Half Light: "No one likes to see what you have t..."
links.text: No one likes to see what you have to see every day.

links.title: You: ""Know anything about the Wild Pines..."
links.text: "Know anything about the Wild Pines representative that's in town?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He looks off to the side, then down..."
links.text: He looks off to the side, then down at his hands. "Can't say I'm a huge admirer of Wild Pines, and I certainly wouldn't trust any silver-tongued spokesperson of theirs. Fortunately, I have no reason to get involved."

links.title: You: ""Wait... what do you have against W..."
links.text: "Wait... what do you have against Wild Pines?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""What should I have *for* it?""
links.text: "What should I have *for* it?"

links.title: You: ""Have you *met* the Wild Pines rep?""
links.text: "Have you *met* the Wild Pines rep?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No, just -- people like that make..."
links.text: "No, just -- people like that make everyone else see the world somewhat askew... at an angle that is convenient for them. Now -- you have more questions, or are we..."

links.title: You: ""Ever had any dealings with the Uni..."
links.text: "Ever had any dealings with the Union Boss?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""He's been by the shop a couple of..."
links.text: "He's been by the shop a couple of times." He gives a lazy half-shrug.

links.title: Composure: "There was something awfully deliber..."
links.text: There was something awfully deliberate about that laziness.

links.title: You: ""Why do I feel like you don't want..."
links.text: "Why do I feel like you don't want to talk about him? Are you hiding something?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""They weren't the most... pleasant..."
links.text: "They weren't the most... pleasant interactions. Small-town Big Wigs always want everyone to play a part in the play they're staging."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""But I bowed out at some point. I p..."
links.text: "But I bowed out at some point. I prefer to watch from afar while the Big Wigs come and go."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "For a moment, his jaw tenses up, an..."
links.text: For a moment, his jaw tenses up, and his gaze is sharp and clear. Then he relaxes again.

links.title: You: ""I heard the forewoman before Evrar..."
links.text: "I heard the forewoman before Evrart disappeared."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes, it was all very strange. That..."
links.text: "Yes, it was all very strange. That forewoman was... more pleasant than Evrart." He shrugs. "But I guess it's all the same in the end..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "There's more to his animosity towar..."
links.text: There's more to his animosity toward the Union Boss.

links.title: You: ""You're not telling me everything a..."
links.text: "You're not telling me everything about the current Big Wig."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He sighs. "Tiphaine Holly, the prev..."
links.text: He sighs. "Tiphaine Holly, the previous head of the Union, was rather *more* pleasant. Some of us around here... well, we've never understood why she didn't run for a second term. Or where she went after withdrawing from politics. It was all very strange."

links.title: You: ""Did he discuss union business with..."
links.text: "Did he discuss union business with you?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""He tried. Wanted to come to some *..."
links.text: "He tried. Wanted to come to some *mutually beneficial arrangement* around my dealings with the dockworkers... I politely declined to *hear him out*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So you don't know what kind of arr..."
links.text: "So you don't know what kind of arrangement he was talking about?" The lieutenant studies the pawnbroker suspiciously.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""As I said, I refused to talk to hi..."
links.text: "As I said, I refused to talk to him. That's why he came back a second time. That's *also* why he hasn't come back a third."

links.title: You: ""What kind of *arrangement*?""
links.text: "What kind of *arrangement*?"

links.title: You: ""Did he buy anything?""
links.text: "Did he buy anything?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""He purchased a remarkably garish p..."
links.text: "He purchased a remarkably garish paperweight the first time he was here... Nothing the second."

links.title: You: ""I have other questions about this.""
links.text: "I have other questions about this."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He nods reluctantly."
links.text: He nods reluctantly.

links.title: You: ""Think you could help me get a corp..."
links.text: "Think you could help me get a corpse out of a tree?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The corpse behind the hostel, I as..."
links.text: "The corpse behind the hostel, I assume..." He looks into the swirling lights, then to you: "I don't have a truck with a mounted platform or anything of that sort myself..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Ask around the harbour. There migh..."
links.text: "Ask around the harbour. There might be some workers there who'd be willing to help."

links.title: You: ""Actually, that's all I've got.""
links.text: "Actually, that's all I've got."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The pawnbroker's gaze is already fi..."
links.text: The pawnbroker's gaze is already fixed on the dancing colours.

links.title: You: ""By the way... do you, um, happen t..."
links.text: "By the way... do you, um, happen to have any *guns*? Like the ones carried by cops?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Someone else came here earlier tod..."
links.text: "Someone else came here earlier today asking the same question -- I promptly sold her the gun you pawned a couple days back."

links.title: Half Light: "WHAT? *Sold*?!"
links.text: WHAT? *Sold*?!

links.title: Logic: "This is a pawn shop... And it *did*..."
links.text: This is a pawn shop... And it *did* feel as if you've met before. Oh god...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shifts from one foot..."
links.text: The lieutenant shifts from one foot to another, alert.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Someone else came here earlier tod..."
links.text: "Someone else came here earlier today asking the same question -- I promptly sold her the gun you pawned a couple days back."

links.title: You: ""I wanted to ask about my, uh... mi..."
links.text: "I wanted to ask about my, uh... missing gun. Again."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sure thing.""
links.text: "Sure thing."

links.title: You: ""Wait, I *sold* you my gun?""
links.text: "Wait, I *sold* you my gun?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You... uhh...""
links.text: "You... uhh..."

links.title: Volition: "With Kim here too?! That just sound..."
links.text: With Kim here too?! That just sounded really, really bad.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You were adamant about getting rid..."
links.text: "You were adamant about getting rid of it, officer." He hesitates. "Said you were *undeserving* of a service weapon of the Revachol Citizens Militia."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""And I don't like keeping guns arou..."
links.text: "And I don't like keeping guns around the shop for long. Off-the-charts photon emissions. The unhealthy kind."

links.title: Empathy: "He's not telling you the whole stor..."
links.text: He's not telling you the whole story. It seems he's trying to spare you.

links.title: You: ""I feel like there's something you'..."
links.text: "I feel like there's something you're not telling me."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He looks away. "You weren't quite y..."
links.text: He looks away. "You weren't quite yourself, officer."

links.title: You: ""What was I like?""
links.text: "What was I like?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You were very distraught. You said..."
links.text: "You were very distraught. You said the gun was a threat to your life, and... that you can't *trust* yourself with it tonight. And you need the money."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""When I said that I don't normally..."
links.text: "When I said that I don't normally buy firearms, you put the gun barrel in your mouth and sort of... sucked on it. Then I agreed to take it."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You sucked on a gun? Good. Good. Ve..."
links.text: You sucked on a gun? Good. Good. Very normal.

links.title: Composure: "Very *normal* behaviour. You must'v..."
links.text: Very *normal* behaviour. You must've been in a great shape.

links.title: You: ""Wait... how much did I sell the gu..."
links.text: "Wait... how much did I sell the gun for?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Fifteen reál.""
links.text: "Fifteen reál."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks from you to Ro..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks from you to Roy and then back to you. It's clear that he hopes this tableau might still turn out to be a bad dream -- it's not, though.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "This has got to be the most.... wow..."
links.text: This has got to be the most.... wow...

links.title: Empathy: "There's *pity* there too. In case y..."
links.text: There's *pity* there too. In case you didn't notice.

links.title: You: ""Happens to the best of us, I guess.""
links.text: "Happens to the best of us, I guess."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It certainly does, especially in R..."
links.text: "It certainly does, especially in Revachol."

links.title: You: ""I really should have killed myself..."
links.text: "I really should have killed myself. Maybe I still will one of these days."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The light swirls in his face and gl..."
links.text: The light swirls in his face and glasses. He doesn't know what to say.

links.title: You: ""I'm so sorry you had to see me in..."
links.text: "I'm so sorry you had to see me in that state. We don't have to talk about it any further."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No apologies necessary, officer.""
links.text: "No apologies necessary, officer."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The light swirls in his face and gl..."
links.text: The light swirls in his face and glasses. He doesn't know what to say either.

links.title: You: "He probably has a good reason for t..."
links.text: He probably has a good reason for that. (Drop the matter.)

links.title: You: ""Was the buyer a policeman too?""
links.text: "Was the buyer a policeman too?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""She didn't seem like a policeman,..."
links.text: "She didn't seem like a policeman, although she kept referring to herself as a *Pig*. Which was odd. I found her interest in the gun a bit... obsessive. But I was just happy to get rid of it. And of her."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Truth be told, she was terrifying.""
links.text: "Truth be told, she was terrifying."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right, so let me get this right,"..."
links.text: "Right, so let me get this right," the lieutenant turns to you, "you sold your sidearm, issued by the Citizens Militia, and now a civilian is running around the streets of Martinaise with it."

links.title: Empathy: "Miraculously, his face does not rev..."
links.text: Miraculously, his face does not reveal what's happening inside.

links.title: You: ""There is only one explanation. She..."
links.text: "There is only one explanation. She must be one of my rabid fans."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In that case, she'll be happy to g..."
links.text: "In that case, she'll be happy to get a visit from us. *If* we can find her..." He looks around, worried.

links.title: You: ""Maybe she's a vigilante. Wants to..."
links.text: "Maybe she's a vigilante. Wants to prove she can do our jobs better than we can."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's possible in these parts of to..."
links.text: "It's possible in these parts of town. We ought to find her and discourage her from taking justice into her own hands." He looks around, worried.

links.title: You: ""I don't like it either. What if sh..."
links.text: "I don't like it either. What if she intends to commit a crime and blame it on the Citizens Militia?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right that she could cast a..."
links.text: "You're right that she could cast aspersions on the force. We have to find her." He looks around, worried.

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. I'm sorry I sold my gun.""
links.text: "I'm sorry. I'm sorry I sold my gun."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He sighs. "Yeah, it's not good. I d..."
links.text: He sighs. "Yeah, it's not good. I do hope we manage to clean this mess up somehow -- while also keeping our focus on the murder investigation."

links.title: Empathy: "'This mess' -- he means *your* mess..."
links.text: 'This mess' -- he means *your* mess.

links.title: You: ""She must be one of my adoring fans..."
links.text: "She must be one of my adoring fans. Just wanted to feel closer to me, you know."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sure, man.""
links.text: "Sure, man."

links.title: Empathy: "He's doubtful, but doesn't see the..."
links.text: He's doubtful, but doesn't see the point in contradicting a notion that is so dear to you.

links.title: You: ""Maybe she's a vigilante. Wants to..."
links.text: "Maybe she's a vigilante. Wants to prove she can patrol the streets more effectively than the Citizens Militia."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh... I certainly hope not.""
links.text: "Oh... I certainly hope not."

links.title: Composure: "He steps further back behind the bu..."
links.text: He steps further back behind the bullet-resistant glass, visibly perturbed. He doesn't want to be involved in any *incidents*.

links.title: You: ""What if she intends to commit a cr..."
links.text: "What if she intends to commit a crime and blame it on the Citizens Militia? On *me*?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He tenses. "I hadn't considered tha..."
links.text: He tenses. "I hadn't considered that... This is why I don't like to deal with guns."

links.title: Drama: "He considered it, but his priority..."
links.text: He considered it, but his priority was to get rid of the gun as quickly as possible -- albeit for a price.

links.title: You: ""You gotta help me find her, man.""
links.text: "You gotta help me find her, man."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I wish I could help with that, off..."
links.text: "I wish I could help with that, officer, but I don't know where she was from or where she was going."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's trying to ingratiate himself w..."
links.text: He's trying to ingratiate himself with you by anticipating your questions. He knows he shouldn't have sold the gun.

links.title: You: ""Any idea where I can find this buy..."
links.text: "Any idea where I can find this buyer?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""My apologies, officer, but I have..."
links.text: "My apologies, officer, but I have no idea where she was coming from or where she went."

links.title: Logic: "A needle in a haystack. There is no..."
links.text: A needle in a haystack. There is nothing you can do about it right now. You'll just have to hope Evrart wasn't lying and the Union can track her down in time.

links.title: Logic: "A needle in a haystack. There is no..."
links.text: A needle in a haystack. There is nothing you can do it about it now. You'll just have to hope you luck upon her somehow.

links.title: You: ""Have people from Evrart Claire's U..."
links.text: "Have people from Evrart Claire's Union come here to track that gun?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Maybe. Shady looking guys came in..."
links.text: "Maybe. Shady looking guys came in here yesterday, looking like they'd just taken off their Wild Pines overalls. They asked if I have a police weapon to sell. I told them I already sold it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""They went their way. It was a trip..."
links.text: "They went their way. It was a trip, but you know. All sorts of people come here, asking for all sorts of things."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait, then it might be true – Evrar..."
links.text: Wait, then it might be true – Evrart's claims.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe Claire really is tracking do..."
links.text: "Maybe Claire really is tracking down your gun." The lieutenant's eyebrows rise slightly. "Hm..."

links.title: Drama: "People as oleaginous as Evrart seem..."
links.text: People as oleaginous as Evrart seem like they're lying even when they're really being truthful.

links.title: You: ""At least now I know how I lost my..."
links.text: "At least now I know how I lost my sidearm. Let's talk about something else." (Conclude.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Of course.""
links.text: "Of course."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for the review. Let's talk..."
links.text: "Thanks for the review. Let's talk about something else."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sure, man.""
links.text: "Sure, man."

links.title: You: ""Do you have any recordings of the..."
links.text: "Do you have any recordings of the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The Col Do Ma Ma Daqua?" He looks..."
links.text: "The Col Do Ma Ma Daqua?" He looks at you with astonishment. "Sorry, I would never have guessed that you were that interested in ultrasonic sounds... or *birds*, for that matter."

links.title: You: ""I've been really into all kinds of..."
links.text: "I've been really into all kinds of art lately. Experimental things, you know."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""What an interesting development! W..."
links.text: "What an interesting development! Well, it's been a while since I've gone hunting for the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Once knew a group of young musicia..."
links.text: "Once knew a group of young musicians who decided they didn't want to play music anymore and started looking for all kinds of interesting sounds instead..."

links.title: You: ""I've been thinking of quitting the..."
links.text: "I've been thinking of quitting the RCM and becoming a cryptozoologist."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""How interesting! Well, it's been a..."
links.text: "How interesting! Well, it's been a while since I've gone hunting for the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua..."

links.title: You: ""I have hobbies. Just like all norm..."
links.text: "I have hobbies. Just like all normal people. Because I'm a normal person."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh, I didn't mean to imply otherwi..."
links.text: "Oh, I didn't mean to imply otherwise... Well, it's been a while since I've gone hunting for the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua myself..."

links.title: You: ""Well, I wouldn't have guessed that..."
links.text: "Well, I wouldn't have guessed that you know what the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua is."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""That's fair. I just... It's been a..."
links.text: "That's fair. I just... It's been a long time since my Col Do Ma Ma Daqua hunting days," he responds with a thin smile. "Once knew a group of young musicians who decided they didn't want to play music anymore and started looking for all kinds of interesting sounds instead..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""This was before... you know. Lost..."
links.text: "This was before... you know. Lost touch with them after all of that."

links.title: You: ""That sounds so cool.""
links.text: "That sounds so cool."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Cool or not... One of them was obs..."
links.text: "Cool or not... One of them was obsessed with recording the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua -- and he was one of those passionate people who know a lot about all kinds of strange things, so he got the rest of us to join in his search..."

links.title: You: ""And did you ever find it?""
links.text: "And did you ever find it?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""We thought we did! We got together..."
links.text: "We thought we did! We got together all these recordings of unusual sound patterns, compared them..." He chuckles. "Cut them up and combined them into the 'Simfonia Col Do Ma Ma Daqua.'"

links.title: You: ""Hm, that's not very scientific.""
links.text: "Hm, that's not very scientific."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""That really wasn't the point. Afte..."
links.text: "That really wasn't the point. After the 'Simfonia' we moved onto the sounds of office supplies or something like that... and I doubt any of us would have been any good at pushing papers."

links.title: You: ""Can I listen to it?""
links.text: "Can I listen to it?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Unfortunately, I don't have any re..."
links.text: "Unfortunately, I don't have any recordings from my... old life. None at all! But I do have a tape with some ultrasonic sounds that *might* be what you're looking for." He starts rummaging through some tapes behind the counter.

links.title: You: ""Get to the point. Do you have any..."
links.text: "Get to the point. Do you have any recordings now?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He purses his lips. "I'm not sure...."
links.text: He purses his lips. "I'm not sure. I wasn't even sure about our old recordings, which I no longer have... But I do have a tape with some ultrasonic sounds that *might* be what you're looking for. Would you like to hear?" He starts rummaging through some tapes behind the counter.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do we really have time for this?"..."
links.text: "Do we really have time for this?" the lieutenant whispers to you.

links.title: You: ""Spin that bird song!""
links.text: "Spin that bird song!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He dusts off a case, then takes out..."
links.text: He dusts off a case, then takes out the tape and places it on the tape player. "This recording comes from down the coast... Wasn't looking to record anything specific -- just left a recording device there one morning."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Keep in mind, I have to slow this..."
links.text: "Keep in mind, I have to slow this one down enough to make sounds well over 200 kHz  audible to the human ear... It will be... strange." He switches on the tape player. The speakers begin to emit a low hum....

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "As the hum grows louder, modulating..."
links.text: As the hum grows louder, modulating, but always unnaturally, uncomfortably low, like it's coming not from the speakers, but also from inside your chest. Breathing is becoming difficult...

links.title: Endurance: "That's an illusion. Your breathing..."
links.text: That's an illusion. Your breathing is just as it was and will remain that way unless you start panicking.

links.title: Inland Empire: "There's a growing sense of dread: t..."
links.text: There's a growing sense of dread: the sound is coming from inside you but also surrounding you. It feels as though someone is standing just outside your range of vision and watching you, doing this to you...

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He nods to you reassuringly just as..."
links.text: He nods to you reassuringly just as more diverse, higher-pitched sounds, some random, some appearing to form patterns, hit your eardrums.

links.title: Logic: "Sea birds, most likely. Gulls and s..."
links.text: Sea birds, most likely. Gulls and such.

links.title: You: ""Seagulls?""
links.text: "Seagulls?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""And skuas. But shhhh." He raises a..."
links.text: "And skuas. But shhhh." He raises a pointer finger and inclines his head toward the speakers. A new, high-pitched, shivering sound.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "That's it! The signal in the noise!..."
links.text: That's it! The signal in the noise! The "thin whisper"...

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "The low range of sounds is easier t..."
links.text: The low range of sounds is easier to handle with a focal point, but still troubling. You are mesmerized by the sounds, but also feel nausea welling up as the motif continues, then begins to recede, dissolving in what must be the sound of water lapping at the bank...

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He switches off the tape player. "Y..."
