links.text: He switches off the tape player. "You know, now that I've listened to it on these new speakers -- it's *not* the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua. Wrong patterns, wrong... photons. Probably some insect trying to sing higher than its predators can hear. Still -- fascinating, aren't they, early morning sounds?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Please..." He throws you a long-su..."
links.text: "Please..." He throws you a long-suffering look. "No more experimental listening while we're on this case."

links.title: You: ""What's that?""
links.text: "What's that?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Gulls and skuas. But shhhh." He ra..."
links.text: "Gulls and skuas. But shhhh." He raises a pointer finger and inclines his head toward the speakers. A new, very high-pitched, shivering sound emerges amidst the others.

links.title: Half Light: "Not good, not good, you're about to..."
links.text: Not good, not good, you're about to start suffocating, you have to stop this...

links.title: You: ""Yes, it's absolutely necessary for..."
links.text: "Yes, it's absolutely necessary for my research."

links.title: You: ""Nah, that's okay. It's just that I..."
links.text: "Nah, that's okay. It's just that I heard the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua outside the Whirling, and I wanted to make sure I wasn't the only one... Let's talk about something else now."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He looks at you oddly. "Alright," h..."
links.text: He looks at you oddly. "Alright," he says, putting the tapes back reluctantly.

links.title: You: ""I have other business to take care..."
links.text: "I have other business to take care of now." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Greetings on this fine night. What..."
dialogueTree.text: "Greetings on this fine night. What brings you here?"

links.title: You: ""You do know that it's not really a..."
links.text: "You do know that it's not really a 'fine night'? The weather is terrible."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Is it?" He turns his head to the r..."
links.text: "Is it?" He turns his head to the right and then to the left, as if looking for non-existent windows. "Spring is capricious, yes."

links.title: You: ""How come you're still open?""
links.text: "How come you're still open?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The pawnshop is always open.""
links.text: "The pawnshop is always open."

links.title: You: ""It's cool that you're still open...."
links.text: "It's cool that you're still open. Big city vibes."

links.title: You: ""Early bird gets the worm, huh?""
links.text: "Early bird gets the worm, huh?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Perhaps." He shrugs. "I just like..."
links.text: "Perhaps." He shrugs. "I just like being awake for the transition between night and morning -- bearing witness to the first hints of light on the horizon."

links.title: You: ""Isn't being forced to get up for w..."
links.text: "Isn't being forced to get up for work at dawn a little inhumane?"

links.title: You: ""I'm so glad you're already awake...."
links.text: "I'm so glad you're already awake. It's so lonely in this city at this hour!"

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Top of the morning to you. How may..."
dialogueTree.text: "Top of the morning to you. How may I be of service?"

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hello again. How can I help you?""
dialogueTree.text: "Hello again. How can I help you?"

dialogueTree.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's not often that I see officers..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's not often that I see officers from the RCM in my pawnshop." The man at the counter turns to you slowly.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""What can I do for you?" he asks."
links.text: "What can I do for you?" he asks.

links.title: Empathy: "His courtesy is not insincere, but..."
links.text: His courtesy is not insincere, but he prefers being alone with his projector, just watching the movement of light across the walls of the shop.

links.title: You: ""Sorry, I feel like I'm interruptin..."
links.text: "Sorry, I feel like I'm interrupting you."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh, no, not at all." He flashes a..."
links.text: "Oh, no, not at all." He flashes a smile. "I guess I haven't had many customers lately, RCM or otherwise."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Who are your customers usually?""
links.text: "Who are your customers usually?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""All kinds of people come through h..."
links.text: "All kinds of people come through here... Locals, travellers. People looking for a deal. People looking for a keepsake. People who are terminally bored."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""As you can see... I have a wide se..."
links.text: "As you can see... I have a wide selection of goods for everyone to choose from."

links.title: You: "(Nod.) "Quite the collection indeed..."
links.text: (Nod.) "Quite the collection indeed."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It keeps me entertained." His atte..."
links.text: "It keeps me entertained." His attention is drawn once more to the play of light and shadow on the walls behind you.

links.title: Composure: "He's well composed, but underneath..."
links.text: He's well composed, but underneath it you sense *psychedelic* processes, bubbling. Some kind of drug maybe?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Entertained? He might be high -- if..."
links.text: Entertained? He might be high -- if he is, on what?

links.title: You: "(Look around.) "Typical vacuous con..."
links.text: (Look around.) "Typical vacuous consumerist objects."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It keeps me entertained," he respo..."
links.text: "It keeps me entertained," he responds, unimpressed with your critique.

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I think some of your sel..."
links.text: "Honestly, I think some of your selections are..." (Press your finger to your lips) "...more tasteful than others."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It keeps me entertained," he respo..."
links.text: "It keeps me entertained," he responds, unimpressed with your snobbery.

links.title: You: ""This business plan is all over the..."
links.text: "This business plan is all over the place. You should specialize, zoom in, recapitalize."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It keeps me entertained," he respo..."
links.text: "It keeps me entertained," he responds, unimpressed with your business-school snobbery.

links.title: You: ""Who are your customers usually?""
links.text: "Who are your customers usually?"

links.title: You: "(Shake your head.) "It's shameful,..."
links.text: (Shake your head.) "It's shameful, how insufficient the police presence is in these parts!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I haven't had any problems myself...."
links.text: "I haven't had any problems myself... though some of my customers have complained about inconsistent law enforcement."

links.title: You: ""Now that the RCM is here -- tell m..."
links.text: "Now that the RCM is here -- tell me, have you had any trouble lately?"
